item.title: Labor is celebrating a successful year but tough budget choices lie ahead
item.description: The level of the prime minister's reform appetite has been discussed and debated since roughly 9pm on election night in May, when Labor's massive win became clear.

item.title: Kangaroos player Ash Riddell has entire school behind her ahead of Saturday's AFLW grand final
item.description: Roos star — and grade 6 teacher — Ash Riddell has an entire school behind her ahead of this Saturday's AFLW grand final.

item.title: Australian music quiz: Test your knowledge of iconic Aussie acts
item.description: Celebrate Ausmusic T-Shirt Day with our Australian music trivia quiz. How well do you know your local legends?

item.title: Fire engulfs high-rise apartment buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Black Friday puts 'social pressure' on shoppers as more Australians rack up credit card debt
item.description: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

item.title: London Broncos rugby league hopes buoyed by Brisbane icon Darren Lockyer and players from PNG
item.description: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

item.title: Rockliff's premiership tied to proposed stadium, but his is not the first to push a contentious project
item.description: With the vote to decide the fate of the Hobart stadium a week away, Premier Jeremy Rockliff's political legacy is in the balance.

item.title: NSW deputy coroner to decide if teen's death was caused by meat allergy from tick bites
item.description: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bitten by ticks outdoors multiple times.

item.title: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli faces a political test on his home turf in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: If the electorate were to vote strongly against the government, it would sting first-term leader David Crisafulli and be spun as a rejection of the LNP's agenda, writes Alex Brewster.

item.title: Here is what we know about Hong Kong's Tai Po fire and the role of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: The blaze in Tai Po that engulfed multiple high-rise apartment blocks is still burning, and authorities say it likely began in bamboo scaffolding that encased the buildings.

item.title: Death toll rises to 55 as Hong Kong blaze continues to burn, three arrested
item.description: A massive high-rise apartment fire in Hong Kong's Tai Po district has killed at least 55 people and left hundreds more missing, with firefighters continuing to battle the blaze — as it happened.

item.title: Mother calls for new age limits after 8yo son killed in e-motorcycle crash
item.description: Kloe Weedon's son Zeke William Hondow, a schoolboy with a sharp wit and even sharper haircuts, was farewelled at a funeral last week.

item.title: Two National Guard members shot near White House in Washington DC
item.description: Authorities say the soldiers were ambushed by a lone gunman while on patrol in Washington, DC, as part of a Trump-ordered crime crackdown.

item.title: Federal politics: Barnaby Joyce quits the Nationals, Labor grilled on power prices in final Question Time of the year — as it happened
item.description: Former deputy prime minister Barnaby Joyce quits the Nationals. Meanwhile, Labor is grilled on power prices in the final Question Time of 2025.

item.title: Kotoni Staggs will continue to represent Kangaroos if Kevin Walters remains coach
item.description: Kotoni Staggs must decide between representing Australia or Tonga at the international level, and says there is one key factor that will tip his decision either way.

item.title: TagEnergy Naracoorte big battery project raises concerns about take-up of agricultural land
item.description: One of Australia's largest battery energy storage systems would be built on farmland in South Australia's south-east in a proposal that the developer says will lower electricity costs.

item.title: Queensland potato farmers help fill supply gap as southern drought causes national shortage
item.description: Potato growers in Queensland's far north are suddenly in hot demand as drought-stricken paddocks in the country's south fail to deliver.

item.title: Department of Transport and Main Roads orders shutdown of North Ipswich Free Shop
item.description: Queensland's transport department has threatened to penalise residents who set up street-side charity cupboards without filling in the requisite paperwork.

item.title: Labor strikes deal with Greens to end environmental reform stalemate
item.description: The years-long stalemate over reforms to environmental laws is set to clear in the final week of the parliamentary year.

item.title: Varroa mite detected in bee hives at Sellicks Hill and Taratap
item.description: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor their hives more frequently after further detections of the deadly bee parasite varroa mite in South Australia.

item.title: Man throwing item over fence
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Matt Renshaw calls under-fire Usman Khawaja one of Australia's best-ever cricketers
item.description: Matt Renshaw is gunning for a spot in Australia's Test side, but does not want it to come at the expense of Australia's veteran opener Usman Khawaja just yet.

item.title: Industry's power woes continue in mining city of Kalgoorlie as peak demand looms
item.description: The WA government has taken the first steps towards fulfilling its election promise of a $150-million, 50-megawatt vanadium flow battery for Kalgoorlie-Boulder.

item.title: National Guard troops being treated after they were shot
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ballarat Gold Mine operators charged over 2024 rockfall that killed miner Kurt Hourigan
item.description: The operators of Ballarat Gold Mine have been charged over a rockfall that killed 37-year-old miner Kurt Hourigan and seriously injured a 21-year-old workmate in March 2024.

item.title: Floods leave at least 50 dead across Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia
item.description: The Thai city of Hat Yai received its heaviest rainfall in 300 years, while mudslides killed dozens on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

item.title: Banking regulator APRA to impose home loan caps amid housing boom
item.description: The banking regulator will impose restrictions on home loans from early next year to limit the number of "high-risk" large loans being issued to customers, which could have flow on effects in the housing market.

item.title: Isolation risks of Australia's social media ban for regional, rural and remote boarding school students
item.description: Regional and remote students are being encouraged to learn old-school ways to stay in contact as social media bans for those under 16 come into effect over the summer holidays.

item.title: Eight-year-old boy injured in reported stabbing at Berwick school
item.description: An eight-year-old boy has been treated for non-life-threatening injuries after a reported stabbing at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Thursday morning, police say.

item.title: Hotter than average summer forecast as fire authorities warn of 'highly flammable' conditions
item.description: An increased risk of bushfire is expected for parts of the country this summer, with most areas expecting hotter than normal temperatures.

item.title: Labor and Greens agree on extra ABC funding for kids' programs
item.description: A deal between the federal government and the minor party will see an extra $50 million go to the public broadcaster to facilitate passage of a bill to impose local content requirements on streaming platforms.

item.title: White wine grape oversupply 'another kick in the guts' for growers already in crisis
item.description: The wine grape industry has written to the SA government pleading for help as it reaches breaking point after indicative pricing for the next vintage is released showing growers could face losses of up to $270 per tonne.

item.title: Search for Samantha Murphy in state park could continue beyond Thursday as police seek 'closure'
item.description: Police say a search of an area of state park near Ballarat for missing woman Samantha Murphy may continue beyond Thursday.

item.title: Government projected to badly miss 2035 climate target, fall shy of 2030
item.description: The Environment Department projects Australia is expected to fall well short of its commitment to cut emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035 — though the minister notes that is before accounting for a number of recent commitments.

item.title: ICC rates Perth pitch 'very good' despite two-day finish, putting spotlight on England's poor batting
item.description: Suggestions the pitch at Perth Stadium was not up to scratch for the first Ashes Test have been well and truly put to bed as the ICC hands down its assessment of the playing surface.

item.title: A new war looms one year on from the Israel-Lebanon ceasefire
item.description: One year after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a ceasefire, the IDF is bombing Beirut again. And Israel has promised its latest strike will not be the last unless Lebanon's government does more to disarm Hezbollah.

item.title: Coroner releases findings into murder of Lilie James at Sydney school
item.description: A NSW coroner has urged young people to consider their use of location-sharing technology after the "senseless" murder of Lilie James at the hands of her ex-boyfriend.

item.title: Motherly love produces sweet jujube crop for grower near regional Victorian city of Mildura
item.description: Jujubes are a relatively unknown fruit for most Australians, but the sweet fruit has strong domestic demand for those looking for a taste of home.

item.title: Why housing, renewables and mining projects may speed up under new environment laws
item.description: Major housing, renewables and mining projects often get bogged down for years by Australia's aging environment laws. Now a deal to rewrite them could change that.

item.title: Future of Tasmania's foresty industry uncertain as Labor, Greens agree on environmental reform
item.description: The government has struck a deal with the Greens to overhaul Australia environmental laws, sparking concerns for the future of Tasmania's native logging industry.

item.title: Bali governor demands demolition of glass lift at Kelingking Beach in Nusa Penida
item.description: A controversial glass elevator at one of Bali's most picturesque beaches will have to be dismantled, with authorities citing planning violations.

item.title: Roger Cook declares he has 'industrial FOMO' as Law Society slams powerful development laws
item.description: Roger Cook declares he has "industrial FOMO" and wants to take every opportunity to bring big projects to the state, as WA's peak legal body slams proposed new laws aimed at fast-tracking development.

item.title: Queensland Health imposes three month closures on illegal tobacco stores after statewide raids
item.description: Dozens of stores across every corner of the state have been closed for three months as officers exercise new powers passed in Queensland's parliament last week.

item.title: Hong Kong inferno puts spotlight on risks of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in three decades draws attention to its risky use of flammable bamboo scaffolding and mesh for building work, in a tradition dating back centuries.

item.title: Head of Queensland child safety inquiry flags subpoena as department accused of ignoring law
item.description: The head of Queensland's child safety inquiry says he "might need to subpoena" files from the department after hearing it was often "not" following its own legislation around preferred permanency options for children in care.

item.title: From harried mums to high-stakes magic here are November's best movies
item.description: November saw the return of two beloved franchises; magic-filled Now You See Me and action classic Predator — but can either live up to their predecessors?

item.title: United States says it has stopped processing all immigration requests from Afghan nationals
item.description: The decision comes hours after US President Donald Trump said he was confident the suspect behind the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington was from Afghanistan.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce quits Nationals, will sit as independent
item.description: The former leader and deputy prime minister has confirmed his long-awaited political move.

item.title: Muhammad Abdur Rehman Mirza jailed over murder of Helen Marsuk after body found in a South Fremantle harbour
item.description: A Perth man who stabbed a woman multiple times in a "ferocious attack" before her body was found in a South Fremantle harbour has been sentenced to 20 years in prison.

item.title: Artificial reefs to be installed in Queensland's Great Sandy Marine Park
item.description: Claims new artificial reefs being installed in a protected marine park could damage a vulnerable natural coral reef are disputed by Queensland's environment minister.

item.title: Live grenade, firearms, sledgehammer seized by police after Sydney shooting
item.description: The NSW Police bomb disposal unit and Australian Defence Force attended to safely remove the grenade.

item.title: How families tracked victims and survivors in real time during Hong Kong's Tai Po tower fire
item.description: When a fatal fire tore through seven high-rise towers in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, thousands of families were glued to a single webpage that offered updates far more quickly than official government briefings.

item.title: Joyce exits, Turnbull returns as Ghosts of Christmas Past haunt parliament
item.description: In the end, it turns out not even a Wagyu steak from Gina Rinehart's cattle company cooked on a sandwich press was enough to lock in Barnaby Joyce's defection to One Nation.

item.title: James Anderson expects England to pick same side for second Ashes Test
item.description: England are unlikely to tinker with their side for the second Ashes Test against Australia starting in Brisbane next week despite being thumped in the opening match, former fast bowler James Anderson has said.

item.title: Guide to listening: Christmas music highlights on ABC Classic
item.description: ABC Classic's Christmas music selection has everyone covered, whether you're a fan of choirs, orchestras, Christmas movies, operas, musicals or video games.

item.title: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low Karenia algal levels
item.description: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

item.title: With a deal on Australia's environmental laws, Murray Watt has cemented his reputation as a 'fixer'
item.description: In his deal with the Greens, Environment Minister Murray Watt has just scraped off one of the biggest barnacles clinging to parliament.

item.title: Woman sentenced over Willetton hit-and-run crash that injured schoolgirl Alexis Lloyd
item.description: A 49-year-old L-plater who kept driving after hitting a 12-year-old as she walked to school in suburban Perth, causing serious injuries, is jailed for 16 months.

item.title: Neuropsychologist in 'emphatic' disagreement over whether alleged murderer had substantial mental impairment
item.description: A neuropsychologist tells the court an NT man accused of murdering an international student was not suffering from a substantial mental impairment at the time of the alleged crime.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: NT rams through changes to Banned Drinker Register amid parliamentary debate on scrutiny
item.description: In the final hours of parliament for the year, the government has extended the time a person issued with a Banned Drinker Order is prevented from drinking alcohol.

item.description: The Iranian Government has condemned Australia's formal listing of its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a state sponsor of terrorism as "offensive and unjustified", accusing the Albanese government of doing Israel's bidding.

item.title: Student paramedic wins battle with Ambulance Victoria over beard policy
item.description: A student paramedic who accused Ambulance Victoria of discrimination on the grounds of race and religion is "ecstatic" to have won his battle to allow cultural beards on the job.

item.description: During sentencing, a Supreme Court Justice told Patrick Lee Brown he "completely disregarded the safety of anyone else" during two different police pursuits, including one in a stolen rental truck with blown-out tyres.

item.description: An expert planning panel has defended their scathing assessment of Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium while speaking to the politicians who will ultimately decide the project's fate.

item.description: Locals are in shock after fire destroyed apartment blocks home to thousands of people, as questions remain about the suitability of building materials and a lack of fire alarms.

item.description: A storm that hit a tiny rural NSW town, damaging one in 10 homes, is psychologically draining for residents.

item.description: Perth have survived a dramatic collapse to beat the Melbourne Renegades by four wickets, denying the Renegades a share of top spot on the WBBL ladder.

item.description: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

item.description: Oscar Piastri says McLaren raised the prospect of the Australian helping his teammate Lando Norris win the Formula 1 world championship, but it was rejected.

item.description: Infrastructure to monitor the impact of rising sea levels and storm surges on the Coorong in South Australia has been installed along the thin strip of coastline between Goolwa Beach and the lagoons of the Ramsar-listed wetland.

item.description: The latest casualty in a year of delayed crops is the cherry, with cold weather in some growing regions setting the festive favourite "weeks" behind schedule.

item.description: Derivates trading operator CME Group says trading in its markets has been halted due to a cooling issue at data centres. Global financial markets watch futures closely.

item.title: Former WA police officer Kaine Burgess relives the night his patrol car was rammed
item.description: More than two years on from a serious crash that saw him medically retired, a former police officer says he can still hear the screech of tyres before the deafening bang of a car slamming into his police wagon.

item.description: A widely criticised bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park will be scrapped in a move celebrated by the Invasive Species Council.

item.description: Nineteen-year-old Estella Jones lives with a disability in her hometown of Tennant Creek, where she loves baking brownies, singing karaoke and spending time with good friends.

item.description: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

item.description: The findings are significant not just because of how much the trial reduced domestic violence, but because only a few years ago it drew fierce criticism from women's advocates and politicians.

item.description: Benedict Bryant had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death over the crash in inner Sydney in February 2022, which killed Jai Wright.

item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died in hospital after an ambush shooting near the White House on Wednesday. A male soldier who was also shot, Andrew Wolfe, is fighting for his life, the president says.

item.description: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

item.title: Rare West Australian seaweed scrapbooks provide glimpse into history
item.description: The State Library of WA is running an appeal to save a set of seaweed scrapbooks made nearly 100 years ago by a renowned Kalgoorlie-born naturalist.

item.description: Just months ago, Hong Kong leaders were dismissing calls for a total ban on bamboo scaffolding on construction sites. Now they are facing one of the region's worst building-fire catastrophes, and anger is growing.

item.description: It's been called a bubble for more than 15 years but the great Aussie housing price boom has barely skipped a beat, as regulators eye the threat of risky loans.

item.description: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

item.description: Lando Norris has match point heading into the penultimate weekend of the Formula 1 season, with the British driver having one hand on a maiden drivers' championship.

item.title: Doctors and nurses claim ramping protocol gives ambulance patients priority access to ED, but paramedics disagree
item.description: Medical experts fear sick or injured Tasmanians who make their own way to emergency departments wait longer than others, due to pressures to fast-track ambulance patients.

item.description: A man aged in his 20s has died after being shot multiple times near a police station in Western Sydney.

item.description: Australia will go into the second Ashes Test against England in Brisbane next week with an unchanged line-up, meaning there is no place for captain Pat Cummins.

item.title: Tasmania's education department and RSB Travel charged over child's attempt to drink engine coolant
item.description: Tasmania's education department and a bus company have both appeared in court after a child with a disability was allegedly left unattended on a bus with access to a bottle of engine coolant in a plastic water bottle.

item.description: Corporate Travel Management helps arrange travel bookings for clients ranging from Wesfarmers to the Australian government.

item.title: Whadjuk Aboriginal Corporation to oversee Rottnest Island cultural services
item.description: A strife-torn Aboriginal corporation crucial to heritage approvals across Perth wins a contract to oversee cultural services on Rottnest Island, Wadjemup, one of Western Australia's premier tourism destinations.

item.description: A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg is heading to auction with a price estimate of more than $40 million.

item.description: The death toll is expected to continue rising after a week of record-breaking rain, flash flooding and a "rare" tropical cyclone.

item.description: The former nurse accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley was 3.7 billion times more likely than not to have contributed to a DNA sample found on a stick where she was buried, his trial has heard.

item.title: Lotterywest cancels licences of seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco or vapes
item.description: Seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco and vapes have their lotteries licences terminated, as attempts to disrupt the illicit and growing trade continues.

item.title: Boy won't face charges after Melbourne primary school stabbing, police say

item.description: A Perth hacker who copied intimate images and sex videos from women's personal online accounts and set up fake Wi-Fi on Qantas flights is sentenced to more than seven years in prison.

item.description: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

item.description: Hong Kong's worst fire in decades exposed long-standing weaknesses in its aging residential blocks. The question haunting the city is whether the disaster could happen again.

item.description: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki wins Supercars grand final sprint race as Chad Mostert narrows gap to leader Broc Feeney
item.description: Brodie Kostecki prevails in wet and wild conditions to win the opening Supercars grand final race, as Chaz Mostert closes in on the championship lead.

item.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA

item.title: Confidence remains in WA iron ore industry despite forecast royalty drop
item.description: Western Australia has long prospered off its hefty irone ore mining royalties, but new figures reveal that revenue may drop by billions.

item.title: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte
item.description: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

item.title: Eight arrested and 128 people dead as alarm faults confirmed in Hong Kong fire
item.description: The arrests come as the probe into what caused the deadly blaze that killed at least 128 people continues.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff Andriy Yermak quits as anti-corruption probe widens
item.description: It come as Kyiv battles to persuade US officials to defend Ukraine's interests in peace agreement talks with Russia expected to take place in the coming days.

item.title: Imran Khan's son and political allies concerned about his health amid block on prison visits
item.description: The family and political allies of Pakistan's former prime minister say they've not been allowed to visit him in prison for weeks but authorities say he is well.

item.title: Putin may laugh but Europe is taking Russian aggression seriously
item.description: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

item.title: Albanese knows the power dynamic between Labor and mining interests has shifted
item.description: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

item.title: Growing concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver
item.description: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.

item.title: John 'Wacka' Williams labels Barnaby Joyce's resignation an 'act of treason'
item.description: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

item.title: Director Peter Weir on capturing the mood for Picnic at Hanging Rock
item.description: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

item.title: Cape Barren Island was returned for Aboriginal self-governance 20 years ago
item.description: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

item.title: Hong Kong tower residents had safety complaints more than 12 months before deadly fires
item.description: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

item.title: Hottest spring on record for Australia's east coast as dangerous weekend storms return
item.description: An ongoing heatwave along Australia's eastern seaboard will fuel further extreme weather this weekend, and its longevity is now breaking long standing records.

item.title: Normalisation of location sharing, tech-facilitated abuse in spotlight after Lilie James inquest
item.description: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

item.title: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard on quitting Spotify, orchestras, raves, and world domination
item.description: Their rock, rave and orchestral music attracts a cult global following. But the prolific, chaotic King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard are just "at peace with failing".

item.title: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines
item.description: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines

item.title: R360 launch postponed from 2026 to 2028, after players withdraw due to threats of NRL bans
item.description: Threats of long bans for prospective R360 players prompted "a handful" of them to withdraw from the rebel league, which now says it will launch in 2028 instead of next year.

item.title: Crowdy Bay shark attack highlights need for first aid devices, drone surveillance on remote beaches
item.description: A makeshift tourniquet may have made the difference between a shark attack on the NSW Mid North Coast this week claiming one life not two. The attack has put a spotlight on how fatalities may be prevented.

item.title: Australia's emissions have dropped, but we've got our work cut out to reach targets
item.description: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

item.title: Man charged with murder after public place shooting in Blacktown
item.description: A 28-year-old man died after suffering gunshot wounds to his neck, chest and leg in Blacktown on Friday.

item.title: Waukaringa mine ruins
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Landscape around Yunta in outback SA
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and searches of mines, dams and scrub have yielded no clues
item.description: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

item.title: Google's global data hub plan for Christmas Island gets mixed reviews from locals
item.description: Google's plans for a data hub could drag this remote island from a digitally starved past into an AI-powered future. But are the locals ready?

item.title: Trolls stole Dr Juliet Turner's joy and in doing so took their own
item.description: The saddest aspect of all this that a generation of boys may feel compelled to suppress the ordinary the joy of celebrating another's success.

item.title: Adoption support service warns against increasing adoption in Queensland
item.description: Queensland should overhaul "outdated" adoption laws that sever children's legal ties to their families, while ensuring adoption remains a last resort, a peak support service tells a commission of inquiry.

item.title: Queensland report on puberty blockers might not see the light of day
item.description: A Queensland government-ordered report on the use of puberty blockers and hormone therapies in the treatment of transgender adolescents is due on Sunday but might never be publicly released.

item.title: Unsettled weekend ahead in south-east Queensland, with 'pretty much nowhere' without chance of thunderstorms
item.description: A wet weekend is forecast for Australia's sunshine state, with meteorologists warning that "pretty much nowhere in Queensland" is without a chance of thunderstorms.

item.title: World-first tournament hopes to 'break down barriers' between the golf and disability communities
item.description: People with intellectual disabilities will have roles in planning, promoting, preparing, and supporting professionals at a charity golf tournament that is the first of its kind.

item.title: Sydney Thunder miss out on WBBL win as Adelaide Strikers clash ended early by rain
item.description: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

item.title: Former premier Peter Gutwein says Hobart AFL stadium has been 'poorly' sold
item.description: Peter Gutwein initiated the push for a stadium in Hobart, but he has had to watch the drama unfold from the sidelines. He says rejecting the proposal would be the biggest "lost opportunity" in the state's history.

item.title: What would it be like to visit Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: From potential gridlock to an "immersive" viewing experience, let's set aside the politics — just for a moment — and look at what planning documents tell us about the building at the heart of Tasmania's fiery stadium debate.

item.title: About 90 Jetstar flights cancelled due to global recall of Airbus A320 planes
item.description: About 90 Jetstar flights have been cancelled across Australia today due to a global recall of Airbus A320 planes for urgent software repairs.

item.title: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs that experts want you to consider
item.description: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

item.title: Cricket Australia set to speak with Usman Khawaja after he labelled Perth Ashes Test pitch a 'piece of shit'
item.description: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

item.title: Survivors of forced adoption in South Australia call for greater recognition
item.description: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

item.title: After suffering 'terrifying' postpartum rage, this mother wants others to know they're not alone
item.description: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

item.title: What must the government prioritise in the new year? | Insiders On Background
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Melbourne Airport terminal fire under investigation after evacuation of Qantas domestic terminal
item.description: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

item.title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina damage exposes need for new Royal Darwin Hospital
item.description: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

item.title: Central Queensland success at Commonwealth coastal rowing in Barbados amid Olympic push
item.description: Though she only tried the sport for the first time this year, the 18-year-old nursing student was one of several Australians taking home gold after competing in coastal rowing in Barbados, ahead of the sport's 2028 Olympic debut.

item.title: Who's thriving and who's barely surviving in Australia, the Land of the Parrots?
item.description: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

item.title: Crowds grow at Melbourne Airport after Jetstar flights are grounded
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Jetstar flight cancellations causes travel chaos for passengers at airports across Australia
item.description: The cancellation of Jetstar flights due to an issue with Airbus A320 planes has left passengers stranded across Australia.

item.title: 'Naughty Boy' pelican draws in visitors and locals in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: Locals say this cheeky pelican has a personality unlike any bird they have ever seen.

item.title: Australia's peak music exam body under fire amid claims of 'slipping standards'
item.description: It is held up as the "gold standard" of music testing in the country, but there are claims the Australian Music Examinations Board is letting down talented students.

item.title: South-East Asia flood deaths rise as Cyclone Ditwah hits Sri Lanka, heads towards southern India
item.description: Parts of South-East Asia have been hit with record levels of rain as a cyclone hits Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides, as the system heads towards India.

item.title: Snowy Mountains farmers call for support in managing spread of invasive weed African lovegrass
item.description: To the untrained eye, African lovegrass is just another plant in the NSW Snowy Mountains. But this golden plant is a deceptive invasive weed that is choking out the landscape, causing some farmers to leave the land.

item.title: Oscar Piastri fastest qualifier for Qatar F1 sprint race, with championship leader Lando Norris third
item.description: Oscar Piastri returns to form by qualifying fastest for the F1 sprint in Qatar, as he launches an unlikely bid to catch McLaren teammate and world championship leader Lando Norris.

item.title: Police seize more than $8m in assets after alleged illicit tobacco raids in the NT
item.description: Police have seized about $8.4 million in assets, including two cars and a jet ski, and almost 1 million cigarettes, following an operation targeting the NT's illicit tobacco trade.

item.title: Conservationists worldwide scrambling for alternative funding after USAID cuts
item.description: Citizen science and AI have never been more important to the environment after White House cuts to USAID are felt beneath the waves, a new report says.

item.title: The Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video
item.description: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

item.title: Melbourne teen who died after nut allergy 'let down' by health system, family says
item.description: Four years after a 15-year-old boy died due to a nut allergy, a Victorian coroner is examining if the death was preventable and whether paramedics and doctors at the Box Hill Hospital provided appropriate care.

item.title: Girl Guides still going strong in Western Australia after 110 years
item.description: The uniforms and pledge may have had a revamp, but the learning, friendships and camping trips at Girl Guides are just as relevant for a new generation more than a century after the organisation first began.

item.title: Mother 'devastated' by police decision to drop murder charges in Kaiden Morgan-Johnston stabbing case
item.description: A 19-year-old man has been released from custody after police withdrew charges against him.

item.title: Five boys injured after jumping castle flies into air in Sydney's west
item.description: Emergency services were called to a property in Bradfield following reports a jumping castle had flown into the air with people onboard.

item.title: RBA could hike interest rates in early 2026 as banks rewrite forecasts
item.description: Hotter-than-expected inflation figures have caught most economists and policy makers off guard. The ongoing price pressures in the economy open the door for an RBA interest rate hike in 2026.

item.title: Skyhooks guitarist Bob Starkie dies aged 73 after a battle with cancer
item.description: A statement released on Skyhooks' official Facebook page announced his passing this morning.

item.title: Parramatta River gets new swimming spot at Gladesville's Bedlam Bay
item.description: While new swimming areas have opened along the river in recent years, an election promise to open a Western Sydney location has stalled.

item.title: Planning to bite into a sweet, juicy mango? Here's what to know about your favourite summer treat
item.description: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

item.title: Victorian coroner determines Mount Buller hiker missing since 2019 is dead
item.description: A Coroner has determined that Niels Gunther Becker, 39, who went missing at Mount Buller in 2019 is dead but that no third party was involved.

item.title: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions of dollars owed in entitlements
item.description: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

item.title: Colin Friels takes on his final stage role in King Lear at Belvoir in Sydney
item.description: Colin Friels, the award-winning actor known for Malcolm and Water Rats, reflects on his 50-year career on stage and screen as he approaches what might be his final role.

item.title: US halts all asylum claims following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington DC
item.description: Less than 24 hours after the shooting, Trump officials began ordering widespread reviews of immigration policies.

item.title: No-bake chocolate and strawberry cake is the ultimate make-ahead dessert - ABC News
item.description: Icebox cakes are retro no-bake desserts made by layering store-bought biscuits and whipped cream. A no-fuss option for summer celebrations, this one can be assembled in 10 minutes and made well ahead of time.

item.title: Best books out in November, featuring Margaret Atwood's memoir and The Mushroom Tapes
item.description: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include a novel that brings to life Britain's only named wind and a new book by the author of The Handmaid's Tale.

item.title: England captain Ben Stokes dismisses 'arrogant' label amid criticism of Ashes Test loss to Australia
item.description: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries Jodie Haydon at The Lodge in Canberra
item.description: Anthony Albanese has married partner Jodie Haydon at his official Canberra residence in a private ceremony on Saturday, after details of the wedding were kept top secret.
